title: Speaker signs Tax Bill
author: Author not found
Content: Speaker Mahinda Yapa Abeywardana signed Value Added Tax (Amendment) Bill on Wednesday (14). The Value Added Tax (Amendment) Bill was passed in Parliament with a majority of votes, with amendments 9 December. The Second Reading for the Bill was thus passed in Parliament with a majority of 82 votes cast in favour of the Bill and 41 cast against. Accordingly, the Value Added Tax (Amendment) Bill is in effect as the Value Added Tax (Amendment) Act No. 44 of 2022 from the 14 December onwards.

title: NARA, NAQDA research centres for Jaffna
author: Author not found
Content: Fisheries Minister Douglas Devananda has made the necessary arrangements to set up the National Aquatic Resources Research and Development Agency (NARA) and National Aquaculture Development Authority (NAQDA) research centres in Jaffna. Devananda said that through the establishment of those research centres it has been planned to expedite the research activities to develop fresh water fisheries in the Northern Province. Minister Devananda met the heads of NARA and NAQDA at the Fisheries Ministry to discuss the matter and instructed them to take prompt action to establish these centres. There is a need to pay more attention towards developing the fresh water fishery because a large number of families across the country are depending on it for their survival, according to Devananda. He said that a large number of investors from China and India, who met him, promised to provide large sums of money to establish sea cucumber fingerlings breeding centres at suitable locations. Devananda said that he told them that only those who can release 25 million sea cucumber fingerlings can come forward. “As the Chinese investors were not willing to introduce their sea cucumber fingerling breeding technology, we have to think further with regard to the provision of permission to establish such centres,” Devananda said. Ministry Secretary Indu Ratnayake, Additional Secretary Namal Thalangama, Director General of Department of Fisheries and Aquatic Resources were also present during the meeting. By Naalir Jamaldeen

title: FSP Secy, Bhikku Federation Convener noticed
author: Author not found
Content: Colombo Chief Magistrate Nandana Amarasinghe on Wednesday (14) noticed eight suspects including Propaganda Secretary of Frontline Socialist Party (FSP) Duminda Nagamuwa, Convener of Inter University Bhikku Federation (IUBF) Ven. Galwewa Siridhamma Thera, and actor Jehan Appuhamy, to appear before him on 31 January 2023. This was in connection with the case filed against them, on charges of Contempt of Court, along with obstructing traffic opposite the Colombo Chief Magistrate’s Court and disrupting the proceedings of Court. The others who were noticed by the Court, were identified as Ven. Rathkarawwe Jinarathana Thera and Ven. Pokunuwita Siridhamma Thera of the IUBF, Amal Salindra, Anjana Rodrigo, and Mala Fernando. Keselwatta Police informed Chief Magistrate Amarasinghe that on 12 December, when a case had been taken up at the said Court, around 100 people had gathered near the Court premises at around 11:45 a.m. Police said this group had then proceeded to obstruct movement of lawyers and the public to and from the Court premises, while engaging in a protest displaying banners and placards, which read ‘Victory to the Aragalaya’ and ‘Release Wasantha Mudalige.’ The prosecution mentioned that the actions of the suspects had flouted Section 140 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 59 (1) of the Thoroughfares Ordinance, and 55 (1) (2) of the Judicature Act and to issue notice on them to appear in Court. By Hansi Nanayakkara

title: Title not found
author: Author not found
Content: Date:  Colombo High Court Judge Amal Ranaraja on Wednesday (14) acquitted former Deputy Minister Shantha Premaratne, who had been charged with soliciting a bribe of Rs 350,000, under the pretext of providing public sector jobs. Announcing the verdict of the trial, Judge Ranaraja, mentioned that the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) had failed to prove the charges filed against the accused, former Deputy Minister, beyond a reasonable doubt. Hence, the Court acquitted the accused from all charges filed against him without calling for submissions from the defence. The Bribery Commission had indicted Premaratne before the High Court, on six counts and over the alleged offence of seeking the said bribe, to provide State employment to children of three individuals in January, 15 years ago. By Hansi Nanayakkara Popular

title: Ports Ministry says Harin’s statement ‘NOT TRUE’
author: By Sulochana Ramiah Mohan
Content: The Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Aviation has categorically stated that there is no truth to the claims made by Minister of Tourism Harin Fernando, during the Mumbai tourism roadshow, that an Indian investor might take control of the three main airports in Sri Lanka, including the BIA. The Tourism Minister, speaking at the Outbound Travel Mart (OTM), India’s leading and only travel show focused on outbound travel, said, “I will break the news that Indian companies are taking our three airports which is going to be a phenomenal decision to really help us. The fuel tanks are taken by the Indian companies, the solar power projects are also taken by the Indians.” Further, the Minister of Tourism also told a Hindu Businessline journalist and the Hindustan Times, Pune News and many other Indian media outlets that were present at the roadshow that discussions are underway between the two sides, potentially involving management contracts. The newspaper quoted Minister Fernando as stating that the Adani Group is in negotiations with Sri Lankan authorities to manage three airports in the island nation, including the BIA. He mentioned plans to collaborate with the Adani Group for airport management, as reported by Businessline on the sidelines of the OTM show in Mumbai. Sources informed Ceylon Today that Minister Fernando has been requested to provide clarification on the matter, as the Sri Lankan Government has no plans to allocate shares to any foreign investors for the BIA or the Ratmalana International Airport. The only finalised agreement concerns the sale of the Mattala Airport to a Russo-Indian joint venture. According to the Aviation Ministry, the statement made by Minister Fernando during the Mumbai roadshow regarding the transfer of the three airports to an Indian investor was misleading information. The Government has clarified that there are no such plans in place for such a transfer. Additionally, the State-Owned Enterprise Restructuring Unit has stated that they have no knowledge of the developments regarding the airport proposals. Ceylon Today has previously reported that the Mattala Airport will be managed by Russia’s Airports of Regions Management Company (AR), in collaboration with an Indian firm, as a joint venture. Sources indicate that the Indian company involved in this venture is likely to be the Adani Group. Secretary of Sri Lanka’s Ministry of Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Aviation K.D.S. Ruwanchandra, however, told Ceylon Today that discussions have led to an agreement to transfer the operations of MRIA to a private joint venture and it is being finalised, but the Secretary did not disclose the names of the investors.

title: Large scale corruption when implementing water projects – PS Member
author: Author not found
Content: UNP member of the Polpithigama PS Ranjith Priya Bandara says that several large scale acts of corruption had taken place, when a few water projects were being implemented with the support of the people of Polpithigama. He made this revelation during the monthly sessions of the said PS held under the aegis of its Chairman SLPP member Ranjith Wijenayake. Bandara stated that these acts of corruption had taken place via the levying of water bills for the drinking water supplied through the Deduru Oya project. He urged the PS to conduct an audit regarding various unions that tend to compile water bills according to their own whims and fancies while fleecing the public and end the acts of frauds taking place. BY Nandana Kelegama – Polpithigama

title: J’pura Marketers hold ‘X-Universe’ to welcome freshers
author: Author not found
Content: X-Universe, an event organised by the second year undergraduates of the University of Sri Jayewardenepura’s Marketing Team, with the objective to develop skills such as leadership, team building and confidence of first year undergraduates, was held recently at the university premises. There were nine groups with 15 members of first year undergraduates in each team competing in six sessions. The event kicked off at around 8.30 a.m. on 1 December. The first session was ‘Fly pool’: a game associated with a swimming pool which paved a fresh opening to the event where all the team members participated. Next, was ‘Galaxy Walk,’ which was organised to provide the chance to test the physical strength of  competitors.  ‘Tele Brain’, was a general knowledge competition. To spice up the competition further ‘Star Kitchen’, a vibrant cooking game was held. The event next in line was the carom tournament.  ‘Tone Comet’ was an open mike singing competition. The event was praised by many for the innovative approach taken by the Marketing Team to welcome the first year undergraduates. BY K.A.D. Tharushi Himasha

title: CEB staff to forego bonuses
author: Author not found
Content: Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) Directors and Trade Unions have agreed to forego bonuses for the year 2022 as directed by the Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL), said PUCSL Chairman Janaka Ratnayake. In a statement, the PUCSL praised the initiative because it would allow CEB to save billions of rupees amid the ongoing crisis. CEB Chairman N.S. Ilangakoon said PUCSL as the regulatory body had sent the request in writing and that he had tabled it with the Board of Directors. Ilangakoon said he also informed the Board of Directors that he must comply with the PUCSL’s decision. President Ranil Wickremesinghe recently revealed in Parliament that CEB has incurred a Rs 300 billion loss since 2013. Wickremesinghe added that if Sri Lanka experiences a drought next year, as predicted, an additional Rs 420 billion will be needed.

title: SLOTS poll shows major political parties not favoured
author: Author not found
Content: The latest Sri Lanka Opinion Tracker Survey (SLOTS) polling shows that the public continue to have deeply unfavourable views of all major political party leaders. SLOTS is conducted by Institute for Health Policy (IHP). President Ranil Wickremesinghe, leader of the UNP, has the least negative favourability ratings, although by a small margin. The past three months have seen a fresh decline in favourability for most, giving back some modest gains since August. Ironically, there is some evidence that Gotabaya Rajapaksa’s ratings have started to recover from the deep lows they maintained for most of the year, with his favourability rating recovering to a net negative 51 per cent in November. In November, President Wickremesinghe was viewed unfavourably by a net 46 per cent of Sri Lankans, but this was still marginally better than other Party Leaders. Opposition and SJB leader Sajith Premadasa had a net negative rating of 57 per cent, not significantly different to that of Anura Kumara Dissanayake, Jathika Jana Balawegaya (JJB) and JVP leader, who had a net negative rating of 55 per cent. SLOTS has been tracking favourability of leading politicians daily since August 2021. Through the end of 2021, President Gotabaya Rajapaksa, leader of the SLPP, maintained an edge in favourability over Opposition Leader, Sajith Premadasa, although some ministers maintained even better favourability ratings, particularly Ministers Ali Sabry and Dr Sudarshini Fernandopulle. But the economic and political crisis that hit at the start of the year collapsed President Rajapaksa’s favourability and dragged down the favourability ratings of all politicians we track, with the public expressing unfavourable views of all by April 2022. From June, the favourability of the other party leaders began to recover but remained deeply negative through October, after which the latest interviews suggest the public is becoming more negative in their views. Ranil Wickremasinghe maintained modestly more negative ratings than Sajith Premadasa through the end of 2021, but since the current crisis hit and following his election as President; his ratings have generally been slightly less negative. However, public views of both of them appear to have become more negative since September 2022. IHP’s Sri Lanka Opinion Tracker Survey (SLOTS) is a telephone survey that interviews nationally representative samples of the public every day. SLOTS tracks favourability by asking respondents if they have a favourable or unfavourable opinion of a public figure or institution: net favourability being the average of the positive and negative responses. The question that SLOTS uses is a standard one used in similar surveys around the world. Scores range from +100 (everyone has a favourable view) to -100 (everyone has an unfavourable view). This is more an indicator of general sentiment about politicians than how people will vote, something that SLOTS tracks separately.

title: Appeal Court stays Cabinet decision
author: Author not found
Content: The Court of Appeal yesterday (14) issued an interim order staying the inclusion of medical specialists and medical doctors in the Cabinet decision to reduce the compulsory retirement age from 63 to 60 years. This was when the Application filed by 176 consultant specialist doctors challenging the decision to reduce the compulsory retirement age of doctors to 60 years was taken up before Court of Appeal Justices Sobitha Rajakaruna and Dhammika Ganepola. While submissions were made on behalf of the petitioners by President’s Counsel Sanjeeva Jayawardena with Attorneys-at-Law Lakmini Warsevitane and Dr. Milhan Mohamed, the Judges issued an interim order staying the application of the Cabinet decision on the compulsory retirement age on medical specialists and medical doctors until the next date. Additional Solicitor General Nerin Pulle raised preliminary objections on the Jurisdiction of the Court to hear the case, stating that the decision is a matter of policy and the Cabinet of Ministers are entitled to make decisions pertaining to matters of policy. Jayawardena, appearing for the petitioners, submitted to Court that the said decision of the Cabinet of Ministers, dated 17 October, has been made illegally and in complete violation of their legitimate expectation to continue in service at least until 63 years of age. The Petitioners’ position is that since 2017, as consultant specialist doctors, they have been guaranteed a defined compulsory age of retirement of 63 years, by both Cabinet Decisions as well as by the Amendment to the Minute on Pensions and therefore, that they were distinctly identified as a separate category, different and separate to that of other categories of public officers in general and that this status and legitimate expectation had been continuing for a period of 5 years, from 2017 up to 2022. They further stated that they have obtained their PGIM Board certification through a gruelling process over the years and that due cognisance had been taken of the important service that they dispense at the apex level of the public healthcare system and curative as well as the preventive segments of the patient care system, in the country. President’s Counsel Uditha Egalahewa and Manohara de Silva appeared for seven other consultants, in connected applications. By Faadhila Thassim

title: Social media ban on Army personnel reimposed
author: Author not found
Content: The Sri Lanka Army has reissued a reminder letter on Army personnel regulations originally issued in 2019, urging them not to use social media to express their political views and to refrain from posting profile photos in Army uniform. Director of the Ministry of Defence Media Centre, Lt. Col. Nalin Herath, told Ceylon Today that this letter was reposted as a reminder of the letter issued in 2019 under the Army Order of June 2017. He further said, it was a reminder to Army personnel of the rule of the Army where they don’t engage in social media postings and reposting views of theirs and others on anti-racial comments, sensitive matters related to religion, race, and gender, expressing hate speech, political views and their stance, sharing national security information that is sensitive and maintained as secrets, any war related expressions or related news and views. He said these regulations are for active Army soldiers and it may also apply to retired personnel. It’s a rule that Army should not be exposing matters that damage their integrity and the country’s image, Col. Herath said. By Sulochana Ramiah Mohan

title: Gazette on max retail price of eggs suspended
author: Author not found
Content: The Court of Appeal yesterday (14) issued an interim stay order to the Consumer Affairs Authority (CAA) to suspend the Extraordinary Gazette issued setting a maximum retail price of eggs, with immediate effect. This was when the Petition filed by the Egg Producers’ Association against the said Gazette was taken up. Further, Court also ordered for the Consumer Affairs Council to report the revised price to Court today (15). According to the Extraordinary Gazette Notification issued by the CAA Chairman under the powers vested in him by Section 20 (5) of the Consumer Affairs Authority Act, No. 9 of 2003 on 19 August 2022, a maximum retail price of Rs 43 was set for white eggs and Rs 45 was set for brown/red eggs. The Gazette Notification prohibited manufacturers, producers, suppliers, distributors and traders from exceeding this price. By Faadhila Thassim

title: President signs Proclamation
author: Author not found
Content: President Ranil Wickremesinghe presented the Proclamation for the development of the historic Hunupitiya Gangaramaya Temple as a place of worship, to Ven. Galaboda Gnanissara Nayaka Thera, the Chief Incumbent of the temple. Former President Gotabaya Rajapaksa and his wife Ioma Rajapaksa also participated in the occasion. The President visited the Gangaramaya Temple yesterday morning (14) on the occasion of the birth anniversary of the Chief Incumbent Ven. Galaboda Gnanissara Nayaka Thera and inquired about his well-being. The President then signed the proclamation document related to the development of the Hunupitiya Gangarama Viharaya, which is highly revered by Buddhist devotees both locally and internationally, and declared it as a place of worship to preserve it for future generations. The Maha Sangha led by Ven. Dr. Kirinde Assaji Thera of the Gangaramaya, former Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa, Minister Bandula Gunawardana, Faizer Mustapha, and President’s Adviser on Climate Change Ruwan Wijewardene attended the event.

title: STF seizes heroin worth Rs 350M
author: Author not found
Content: The STF seized a stock of heroin worth nearly Rs 350 million from a residence in Mulleriyawa. The stock weighed 12 kg and the STF said they believe the haul belongs to a drug lord named Ponnapperuma Arachchige Dhanushka Buddhika, alias ‘Jile.’ He is believed to be one of the main accomplices of Angoda Lokka. Two individuals were arrested with the drug stock. Police said ‘Jile’ has fled to India.  The suspects were handed over to the Police Narcotics Bureau (PNB).

title: Sathosa drops prices of five food items
author: Author not found
Content: Lanka Sathosa has taken steps to reduce the prices of a variety of essential food items. Prices for red lentils, canned fish (local), big onions, wheat flour, and garlic have been reduced as a result. According to Lanka Sathosa, the price of 1 kg of red lentils has been reduced by Rs 4 to Rs 385. The price of 425 g of canned fish (local) has been reduced by Rs 5 to Rs 490. The price of big onions is Rs 190 per kg, which has been reduced by Rs 9. Further, the price of 1 kg of wheat flour has been reduced by Rs 15, and the price of a 1 kg of garlic has been reduced by Rs 35, with the new prices being Rs 250 and Rs 460, respectively. The above prices came into effect on 14 December.

title: SC to hear Dr. Sanjeewa’s FR Petition
author: Author not found
Content: The Supreme Court yesterday (14) granted leave to proceed with the Fundamental Rights Petition, filed by Dr. Galmangoda Guruge Chamal Sanjeewa, who was interdicted based on several allegations, following statements recently made by him with regard to malnutrition among children in Sooriyawewa. It was stated in the petition that Dr. Sanjeewa, in his capacity as the President of the Medical and Civil Rights Professional Association of Doctors, visited the Walsapugala Koswagawa village in Sooriyawewa, Hambantota District to run a medical clinic for children to check their nutrition levels, health and that accordingly he conducted a survey. Further, out of the 20 children whose clinic cards were examined, about six were at severe malnutrition levels and about 10 were at moderate malnutrition levels in the weight chart of the Child Health and Development Record (CHDR). It was stated in the Petition however that the statements made by him were embellished by certain media entities. While stating that he was interdicted on the basis that his acts were in violation of the Establishment Code, Dr. Sanjeewa further stated that the observations however made by him cannot be regarded as an act in violation of the provisions of the relevant Act. He said thereby that the decisions of the Respondents resulted in the infringement of Petitioner’s Fundamental Rights guaranteed under Article 12(1), 14(1)(a) and 14(1)(g) of the Constitution. The petitioner also sought compensation of Rs 10,000,000. Minister of Health Dr. Keheliya Rambukwella, Secretary to the Ministry of Health S. Janaka Sri Chandraguptha, Director General of Health Services Dr. Asela Gunawardena, the Chairman of the Public Service Commission, the Attorney General and 18 others were named as respondents to the Petition. By Faadhila Thassim

title: Suspect who attacked Mercedes passenger arrested
author: Author not found
Content: The suspect who assaulted a passenger of the Mercedes car involved in a fatal accident in Kollupitiya on 10 December was arrested by Police last evening (14). The 24-year-old woman was arrested in Panadura. A 58-year-old three-wheeler driver was killed when a Mercedes car returning from a night club crashed into his three-wheeler in Kollupitiya on 10 December. The suspect, along with two other onlookers, assaulted a female passenger in the car. Police arrested two women in connection with the assault, on 11 December, and sought public assistance to track down the suspect.

title: Power-sharing agreement won’t materialise – Gammanpila
author: Author not found
Content: How is it possible for President Ranil Wickremesinghe to bring proposals for power-sharing arrangements in the country in just 52 days, when such attempts have failed for the past 65 years, Pivithuru Hela Urumaya (PHU) Leader, MP Udaya Gammanpila said. Speaking at a media briefing yesterday (14), Gammanpila said the President has pledged to bring a proposal to share power before the next Independence Day. “There is only 52 days for 4 February 2023. This issue has been ongoing for 65 years. We saw how this went throughout history. Every time leaders like Wickremesinghe brings proposals to share power like this to please the Tamil separatists, severe objections were raised by the Sinhalese community. Then those proposals had to be folded. So, we know what will happen to any proposal that brings a federal system. The same thing will happen this time too,” he said. Speaking further, Gammanpila said the Government is deceiving the country by claiming that the International Monetary Fund (IMF) loan will be approved in January, followed by a USD 1 billion loan from the Asian Development Bank. The truth is the Government has failed to reach a final agreement on bilateral loans, he said. He said there are local loans, bilateral loans, multilateral loans, and international market loans. “Multilateral loans are those obtained from international organisations such as the World Bank, the IMF, and the ADB. The Government has not had any meaningful discussions about multilateral debt restructuring. Countries such as Zimbabwe have negotiated with these international institutions and restructured their debt,” he said, adding that the Sri Lankan Government is yet to begin discussions. By Thameenah Razeek

title: Consensus over constitutional provisions on power sharing – TNA
author: Author not found
Content: President Ranil Wickremesinghe, who presided over the All Party Conference (APC) on Reconciliation on 13 December at the Presidential Secretariat, pledged to update Cabinet in February 2023 on the status of the conference’s decisions to address the major issues in the reconciliation process, as mandated by United Nations Human Rights Council (UNHRC) Resolution 46/1 on ‘Promoting reconciliation, accountability, and human rights in Sri Lanka,’ adopted on 23 March 2021 and same adopted at the 51st session of the UNHRC tabled by the Core Group this year. The APC resulted in all parties agreeing to the constitutional provisions regarding power sharing, and the President agreed to meet them again next month for discussions, according to Tamil National Alliance (TNA) Spokesman M.A. Sumanthiran. He also said their main proposals to immediately address the land taken from private owners, justice for the disappeared, and the release of the remaining prisoners detained under the Prevention of Terrorism Act should be implemented before the Independence Day celebrations next year. Sumanthiran said they requested to work on all in parallel by 31 January 2023. Sumanthiran said the President had previously stated that he would address Tamil issues before the Independence celebrations, and that they had reminded him of this. Also discussed was the new Constitution’s power sharing module, to which Foreign Minister Ali Sabry reiterated South Africa’s Truth and Reconciliation Commission model. Justice Minister Dr. Wijeyadasa Rajapakshe on the other hand said they have begun expediting investigations on the disappearances that took place during the war. He said there are 65 more cases of disappearances that his ministry will look into. The TNA stated that the President submitted the draft in 2019 and that it will be taken forward. It was said discussing about constitutional reforms takes time. Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa had also backed the TNA in this regard. Before discussing the new Constitution and the federal structure of power sharing, on which the President had not commented, the TNA had also reiterated that the Provincial Council Elections must be held. Meanwhile, Leader of the Tamil Progressive Party (TPA), MP Mano Ganesan claimed that the discussion was not limited to the North and East. “The implementation of the 13A is the point to which the majority have agreed while being present there,” he added. He also pointed out that the provincial council mechanism is operational in all nine provinces. “Many party leaders, including the President, Mahinda Rajapaksa, and Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa, have publicly expressed their support for 13A. So let that serve as the starting point.” “I drew the attention to the fact that the full implementation of 13A would be the way forward once the chief ministers’ conclave with much Southern Provincial Council wanted it,” he said. By Sulochana Ramiah Mohan

title: X-Ray Fiasco at Kurunegala Hospital
author: Author not found
Content: The lack of a proper networking system to obtain X-ray images has created a dilemma for the patients obtaining X-rays from the Radiology Department of Teaching Hospital Kurunegala, as they are forced to photograph images of their X-rays to present it to the relevant doctor. Explaining the situation, President of the Academy of Health Professionals (AHP), Ravi Kumudesh yesterday (14) said the Government had spent a large sum of money between 2016 to 2018 to purchase digital and Computerised Processing Units to upgrade the X-ray service. Till then, the traditional system was being used in hospitals. With the new system in place, the X-ray could be used at any time and in any place as a referral.   “But like buying the cow and not the rope, the machines were purchased without providing the networking system,” he lamented. Only National Hospitals Colombo and Kandy, and Teaching Hospital Karapitiya were given the networking facility. Teaching Hospital, Kurunegala was never availed of the network facility despite having the digital technology to take the X-ray images. It has been forced to use the traditional method of issuing X-ray film for its upgraded digitalised method of taking X-rays.  Many hospitals with the digital or computerised X-ray facility were forced to combine the technologies obtained with the turn of the millennium with that of the traditional method used in the 1990s. There was no networking facility to send the image to the doctor and the patient for reference. “Authorities of Teaching Hospital, Kurunegala are now faced with a quandary as bills for the X-ray film that have been purchased have not been paid and therefore the supplier has stopped providing film,” Kumudesh alleged. The Hospital had to spend around Rs 2 million each month for X-ray film alone.   He said, at present, patients are asked to use their smart phones to photograph the image of the X-ray to present it to their relevant doctors. Attempts to contact the authorities of Teaching Hospital, Kurunegala were futile. By Dilanthi Jayamanne

title: SL yet to receive creditor assurances – Semasinghe
author: Author not found
Content: As crisis-hit Sri Lanka awaits the outcome of twice-failed talks with the International Monetary Fund (IMF) for a USD 2.9 billion bailout package, State Minister of Finance Shehan Semasinghe, said yesterday (14) that Sri Lanka is yet to receive financial assurances from its bilateral creditors. He said, at the outset the IMF’s Executive Board expressed that they do not expect to formally approve Sri Lanka’s bailout before the end of this year. The bilateral creditors are India, China, and Japan, and their debts to Sri Lanka must be restructured in accordance with the IMF’s recommendations to obtain the loan facility, but IMF’s online board calendar, which has added meetings through 22 December to discuss progress, makes no mention of a meeting with Sri Lanka. Sri Lanka has been urging the bilateral creditors to cooperate in assisting the country, as mounting debts have hampered the country’s finances. State Minister Semasinghe added that bilateral creditors have expressed their desire to support Sri Lanka and they are thankful to the creditors. The Minister added that the authorities are having continuous progressive discussions and exchange of information. “We will miss the intended formal approval of IMF in December 2022, but are working hard to complete the required process by early next year,” he said. Last week, Central Bank Governor Dr. Nandalal Weerasinghe said if creditor assurances from China and India can be obtained this month, Sri Lanka can expect IMF Rapid Financing approval in January. Also, last week, IMF Managing Director Kristalina Georgieva said she had a “fruitful exchange” with her Chinese counterparts about repeated calls for accelerated debt relief to countries like Zambia and Sri Lanka. By Sulochana Ramiah Mohan

title: Customs seizes crystal meth worth Rs 13M
author: Author not found
Content: The Customs Narcotics Control Unit, yesterday (14), seized crystal methamphetamine worth over Rs 13 million which was sent to a Matara resident from Mexico. A suspicious courier parcel from Mexico to a person in Matara was inspected by officers of the Narcotics Control Unit of Customs, and 650 g of crystal methamphetamine was found concealed in a bag. The person who came to pick up the parcel was detained. This is the first crystal methamphetamine seizure from Mexico in recent history. The estimated value of the drug haul is around Rs 13 million. Further investigations have been launched in this connection. (NV)

title: Title not found
author: Author not found
Content: Date: President Ranil Wickremesinghe said, the ‘National Youth Platform’ is a great opportunity for the youth to present their vision of the country’s future to the Government. The President said, this during a discussion on the special project to be launched under the National Youth Platform in conjunction with the 75th Independence Day celebration that was held on Tuesday (13), at the Presidential Secretariat. President Wickremesinghe said, the future development plans of the country should be prepared not for today, but for the next 25 years and the expectation is to maximise the contribution of the youth, adding that when the centenary of independence is celebrated in another 25 years, the youth of the country will be the leaders of the country. Therefore, the President also pointed out that the youth can present their vision, plans and creative skills to the Government through the National Youth Platform for building the developed country that they desire. The preliminary plan for engaging the university system in this project was presented by the Presidential Director of Youth Affairs and Sustainable Development Randula Abeweera. Accordingly, it was proposed to implement these programmes with the participation of the universities based in the districts of Colombo, Galle, Jaffna, Kandy and Batticaloa. State Minister of Higher Education Dr. Suren Raghavan, State Minister of Technology Kanaka Herath, and the participating University Chancellors presented their ideas and suggestions regarding this plan. This plan will introduce a series of programmes mainly targeting the tourism industry. The President also highlighted the importance of engaging the university youth in this programme. The President also issued instructions to engage the public and private universities for this purpose. The President also mentioned that new tourism policies would be introduced next year to promote the tourism industry. In addition, the President presented many plans to be implemented in the future to direct the university system of Sri Lanka on a new path. The President, who expressed his views on ragging, advised the Vice Chancellors to implement an organised programme to prevent ragging at universities. The President also emphasised how the structure of the university system should be changed to create universal access to university education. Popular

title: Four arrested with 14 g heroin
author: Author not found
Content: Four suspects were arrested in Gothatuwa and Wellampitiya with over 14g of heroin. The arrests were made by the Colombo Crime Division on 13 December. Accordingly, two suspects were arrested in Wellampitiya on 13 December with over 8g of heroin and the other two suspects were later arrested in Gothatuwa with over 6g of heroin. The suspects are 25, 31, 33 and 34-year-old residents of Wellampitiya and Borella. An individual was stabbed to death by a group in Mattakkuliya on 28 November and Police were conducting investigations to arrest the suspects.  Police investigations showed a dispute over money led to the murder. By Aloka Kasturiarachchi

title: Ports Ministry says Harin’s statement ‘NOT TRUE’
author: By Sulochana Ramiah Mohan
Content: The Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Aviation has categorically stated that there is no truth to the claims made by Minister of Tourism Harin Fernando, during the Mumbai tourism roadshow, that an Indian investor might take control of the three main airports in Sri Lanka, including the BIA. The Tourism Minister, speaking at the Outbound Travel Mart (OTM), India’s leading and only travel show focused on outbound travel, said, “I will break the news that Indian companies are taking our three airports which is going to be a phenomenal decision to really help us. The fuel tanks are taken by the Indian companies, the solar power projects are also taken by the Indians.” Further, the Minister of Tourism also told a Hindu Businessline journalist and the Hindustan Times, Pune News and many other Indian media outlets that were present at the roadshow that discussions are underway between the two sides, potentially involving management contracts. The newspaper quoted Minister Fernando as stating that the Adani Group is in negotiations with Sri Lankan authorities to manage three airports in the island nation, including the BIA. He mentioned plans to collaborate with the Adani Group for airport management, as reported by Businessline on the sidelines of the OTM show in Mumbai. Sources informed Ceylon Today that Minister Fernando has been requested to provide clarification on the matter, as the Sri Lankan Government has no plans to allocate shares to any foreign investors for the BIA or the Ratmalana International Airport. The only finalised agreement concerns the sale of the Mattala Airport to a Russo-Indian joint venture. According to the Aviation Ministry, the statement made by Minister Fernando during the Mumbai roadshow regarding the transfer of the three airports to an Indian investor was misleading information. The Government has clarified that there are no such plans in place for such a transfer. Additionally, the State-Owned Enterprise Restructuring Unit has stated that they have no knowledge of the developments regarding the airport proposals. Ceylon Today has previously reported that the Mattala Airport will be managed by Russia’s Airports of Regions Management Company (AR), in collaboration with an Indian firm, as a joint venture. Sources indicate that the Indian company involved in this venture is likely to be the Adani Group. Secretary of Sri Lanka’s Ministry of Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Aviation K.D.S. Ruwanchandra, however, told Ceylon Today that discussions have led to an agreement to transfer the operations of MRIA to a private joint venture and it is being finalised, but the Secretary did not disclose the names of the investors.

title: Korean fans enjoy K-Fiesta
author: Author not found
Content: Sri Lankan Korean fans gathered at Colombo Racecourse, in November to enjoy K-Fiesta, part of the Korean Cultural Festival sponsored by the Korean Embassy and organised by Embassy SNS supporters and the K-pop official fan page. The event featured Korean food stalls, K-pop merchandise, and a K-pop Random Play Dance that attracted many Sri Lankans from all walks of life. The K-Fiesta was open to the public and people interested in Korea. Korean Envoy, Santhush Woonjin Jeong participated in this event to witness the merriment and high spirits of the young crowds. Celebrating the 45th anniversary of diplomatic relations between Korea and Sri Lanka, the Korean Embassy has organised a series of cultural events like the Korean Lantern Festival, Quiz on Korea, World K-pop festival, Korean Ambassador’s Taekwondo Championship, Korean Film Festival, and the Virtual Tour. Following the resounding success of these past events, the K-Fiesta was another opportunity to bridge our two cultures together and to enjoy a variety of Korean dishes, dance to beloved K-pop songs, and purchase K-pop merchandise.  With the increasing popularity of K-pop in Sri Lanka, especially among the youth, the Korean Embassy organised the K-pop Random Play Dance for the first time in Sri Lanka, to create a platform for K-pop lovers to dance to the tunes of their favourite songs. It was a great success as many young people enjoyed it wonderfully, dancing to songs played by K-pop bands like BTS, Blackpink, NCT, Stray Kids, etc. (SRM)

title: Human resources committees to be set up – Manusha
author: Author not found
Content: Labour and Foreign Employment Minister Manusha Nanayakkara has decided to appoint human resources committees by involving the officials in all the divisional secretariats under the Labour and Foreign Employment Ministry. In a statement, the Ministry said these committees are to be established by involving the development officers of the Ministry of Labour, Productivity Secretariat, Human Resources and Employment Department, and the labour officers attached to each divisional secretariat. These are established to directly obtain grassroots opinions necessary for formulating policies at the national level in creating a workforce suitable for the international labour market. Accordingly, Nanayakkara said through direct and efficient acquisition of grassroots opinions in national policymaking, there will be scope for practical and efficient policymaking. He added that these committees are going to identify the problems at the village level and implement a programme to bring them to the national level.  Nanayakkara further advised that the necessary activities for the establishment of these committees should be started immediately and the responsibilities of managing these committees should be assigned to an additional secretary of the ministry. (NV)

title: Six-year-old beaten to death
author: Author not found
Content: A six-year-old child died after being beaten by his stepfather in Gampaha Police Division. The child was admitted to the Gampaha Hospital by Police Officers after he was attacked by his stepfather on 12 December. However, he had succumbed to injuries on 13 December, Police said. Investigations showed the child’s stepfather had assaulted the child on numerous occasions. The suspect was arrested and remanded till 22 December by the Gampaha Magistrate. Gampaha Police are conducting further investigations. (To report child abuse and violence against children dial 1929 – the hotline of National Child Protection Authority (NCPA)) By Aloka Kasturiarachchi

title: Sirisena cannot get away scot free – Premitha
author: Author not found
Content: Former President Maithripala Sirisena cannot be freed from responsibility for the Easter Sunday Attacks, State Minister of Defence Premitha Bandara Tennakoon said. Responding to concerns by Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) MP Thushara Indunil in Parliament, Tennakoon said at the time of the Easter Attacks, the post of President, Defence Minister, Commander-in-Chief, and Police Minister were all held by former President Sirisena. “We never think that he can deviate from that responsibility. This is our stance,” he said. By Aloka Kasturiarachchi

title: China a true friend of SL
author: Author not found
Content: Minister of Trade Bandula Gunawardana said China, as Sri Lanka’s closest friend, has always stood by the country in difficult times. The Minister said, this during the presentation of prizes and certificates to the winners of the ‘Silk Road – 2022’ All Island Art and Essay Competition, which marked the completion of 65 years of China-Sri Lanka diplomatic relations and the signing of the Rubber Rice Pact. Gunawardana also said, China and Sri Lanka share longstanding relations. “As a close friend of our country for a long time, China has supported us whenever the country faced difficult situations. A study undertaken by me revealed that trade relations existed between China and Sri Lanka before the time of Faxian. I had the opportunity to write a thesis on China-Sri Lanka relations at the Beijing Foreign Studies University for about three years thanks to a Chinese scholarship,” he said. He expressed hope that the Sri Lanka-China Friendship Association will be able to strengthen the development of the Silk Road and friendship between China and Sri Lanka for all of this country’s children. “I express my gratitude and respect to the Sri Lanka-China Friendship Association for launching this valuable programme from Kelaniya Vidyalayankara for children islandwide, appreciating their talents and skills,” he added. By Thameenah Razeek

title: SL-India ferry service to be launched
author: Author not found
Content: Steps have been taken to start a ferry service between South India, Kankesanthurai (KKS), Trincomalee, and the Port of Colombo. A special discussion on this was held on the initiative of Minister of Ports, Shipping and Aviation Nimal Siripala de Silva at the Ministry auditorium on Tuesday (13). As an initial step, the new ferry service will be commenced in mid-January next year between KKS and Pondicherry. “The Indian Government has extended consent for the service,” the Minister said. “A large number of Indian citizens are engaged in business activities in Jaffna Peninsula. With such engagement, the new service is expected to generate a large portion of foreign revenue. It will also be of immense convenience for Buddhist pilgrims to India.” Ferry owners at the discussion emphasised that the already available facilities at the ports should be further upgraded to continue a better service. The Minister instructed the Ministry Secretary to take immediate steps to develop infrastructure related to Customs, Immigration and Emigration and other facilities at the Sri Lankan ports according to the government procurement procedures. Ferry owners said the vessels under the new service will carry 300 to 400 passengers in a trip that will take about 3.5 hours between destinations. Boat owners emphasised that they will charge USD 60 per passenger as fares for one journey and that they can carry 100 kg of luggage. Ministry Secretary K.D.S Ruwanchandra, Immigration and Emigration Department Controller General I.S.H.J Ilukpitiya, and other officials and a group of passenger vessel owners also participated in the discussion.

title: SL’s Talal Rafi to deliver keynote address
author: Author not found
Content: Talal Rafi from Sri Lanka will deliver the keynote speech on ‘Business Policy & Strategy for inclusive growth and development’ at the 17th Academy of Global Business Research and Practice International Conference (hybrid event) to be held at the Metropolitan Hotel, Dubai, UAE from 20-22 December. Talal will speak on institutional leadership, corporate governance, balancing stakeholder interests, and the impact of offshoring and outsourcing. The Academy of Global Business Research and Practice (AGBRP) aims to promote academic research and scholarship that would facilitate effective teaching and student learning, and emphasises the imperative need for academics and organisations from across industries and sectors to collaborate and engage each other. Talal Rafi is a Senior Global Management Consultant at Deloitte Consulting focusing on corporate strategy. He was on Deloitte’s global ESG operations team. He is an Expert member of the World Economic Forum and Co-Chairs the Global Plastics Innovation Network action group of the World Economic Forum. Talal has given talks globally including at the NASDAQ Centre, S&P Global and the Central Bank of Sri Lanka and is a regular contributor in thought leadership for the Davos Agenda. His work has been published by the World Bank, International Monetary Fund, Asian Development Bank, World Economic Forum, UNFCCC (United Nations), London School of Economics, and Forbes.

title: Low quality scales to be banned – Amaraweera
author: Author not found
Content: Minister of Agriculture Mahinda Amaraweera will submit a Cabinet Paper to establish a mechanism to prevent the smuggling of fake scales that exploit farmers and consumers islandwide. He highlighted all scales should be registered once a year with the Weight and Measurement Units, Standards and Services Division at the District Secretariat, but it has been revealed that many of the scales in the country are not. According to the Minister, because most of the scales used in Sri Lanka are of poor quality, farmers are being exploited in the purchase of their products. The Minister said, this during a discussion at the Ministry of Agriculture. “In Bulathsinhala, Police intervened and weighed a bag of urea fertiliser given by an agricultural service centre, but it was reported that the required amount of fertiliser was in the proper weight,” he said. In this regard, Amaraweera said many traders weigh produce using hanging bow scales, adding that most of these scales are of poor quality, and traders steal a large portion of the farmers’ income. He also pointed out that even if only two kilogrammes of each farmer’s produce is swindled, it costs farmers a fortune in the long run. Thus, the Minister directed Agriculture Secretary Gunadasa Samarasinghe to immediately begin a joint work arrangement with the Weighing and Measuring Department to prevent the use of these fake scales.

title: Jaffna-Palaly bus service launched
author: Author not found
Content: A bus service has been launched between Jaffna and Palaly beginning 12 December, Northern Province Road Passenger Transport Authority Chairman, E. Ravindran said on Tuesday (13).    The Chairman said, Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) busses have been added to the service between Jaffna and Jaffna International Airport in Palaly. He said, passenger flights from Chennai to Jaffna Airport will operate every Monday, Tuesday, Thursday, and Saturday. The flight from Chennai is scheduled to land in Palaly at 10:30 a.m. and will depart for Chennai at11:50 a.m. Bus services for airline passengers will operate from Jaffna Bus Stand to Palaly on aforesaid dates beginning at 8:00 a.m. The bus service from Palaly to Jaffna will operate around 12:00 p.m. If required, transport services will be provided till Jaffna Railway Station, Ravindran said. By Naalir Jamaldeen

title: HC Moragoda meets Shringla in New Delhi
author: Author not found
Content: Sri Lanka’s High Commissioner to India Milinda Moragoda met Chief Coordinator for India’s G20 Presidency for 2023, Harsh Vardhan Shringla in New Delhi  and held  discussions focusing on various avenues through which Sri Lanka could engage with the G20 during India’s Presidency of the Group and also the possibility of understanding G20 approach towards international financial cooperation and debt restructuring. High Commissioner Moragoda and the Chief Coordinator discussed the opportunities available to Sri Lanka, as a neighbouring country of India, to engage with the work of the G20 on 12 December. India assumed the G20 Presidency on 1 December for a period of one year. Under its Presidency, India is expected to host over 200 G20 meetings in 56 cities across the country, beginning December 2022. The G20 Leaders’ Summit at the level of Heads of State/ Government is scheduled to be held on 9 and 10 September 2023 in New Delhi. The G20 or Group of Twenty is an intergovernmental forum comprising 19 countries and the European Union, which works to address major issues related to the global economy, such as international financial stability, climate change mitigation, and sustainable development. Before assuming office as the Chief Coordinator for India’s G20 Presidency, Shringla was the Foreign Secretary of India. An officer from the Indian Foreign Service, he had previously served as India’s Envoy to Thailand, Bangladesh, and the United States. (SRM)
